alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 12:38PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following county, Mohave. * WHEN...Until 145 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1235 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Although the storms are moving out of the area, the risk for flooding due to runoff remains. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pierce Ferry And Antares Roads, Dolan Springs and Grand Canyon Ranch. - This includes the following roads... Pierce Ferry Road between mile markers 1 and 30. Stockton Hill Road between mile markers 24 and 43. Highway 93 in Mohave County between mile markers 27 and 51. Antares Road between mile markers 14 and 32. Diamond Bar Road between mile markers 1 and 8. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
